intro: Crambe gomeraea, commonly known as the Gomera crambe, is a rare flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. It thrives in rocky, coastal environments and is adapted to the humid, subtropical climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a vulnerable species.
